variables_and_types.title: Variables and Basic Data Types
variables_and_types.code:
x = 5  # integer
name = 'Alice'  # string
is_active = True  # boolean
pi = 3.14  # float
x = 'extra'  # string
variables_and_types.explanation: Shows how to create variables with different data types: integer, string, boolean, float. There's no need to declare a type in Python, it will be assigned at the creation and can be overwritten as with variable 'x' in the snippet.

list_operations.title: List Creation and Basic Operations
list_operations.code:
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']  # create list
fruits.append('plum')  # ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry', 'plum']
print(fruits[1])  # banana
fruits.remove('apple')  # ['banana', 'cherry', 'plum']
fruits_sorted = fruits.sort(reverse=True)  # ['plum', 'cherry', 'banana']
list_operations.explanation: Creates a list, appends an item, accesses element by index, and removes an item. Last method sorts the list by descending (reverse) order.

dictionaries.title: Dictionary Basics
dictionaries.code:
person = {'name': 'Bob', 'age': 30}  # create a dictionary with keys 'name' and 'age'
print(person['name'])  # prints person's name - Bob
person['age'] = 32  # assign new value to the person's 'age' key
person['interests'] = ['python', 'music', 'books']  # add new key 'interests' to the persons dictionary and assign a list of interests
person.pop('name)  # {'age': 32, 'interests': ['python', 'music', 'books']
dictionaries.explanation: How to create a dictionary, access values by key, and update value. Next add a new item and assign a list of values to it, and lastly remove an item.
